channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Leon Thomas on his new EP 'Pholks'
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with R&B musician Leon Thomas, who describes his new EP Pholks as a collaboration of polymaths inspired by multi-talented artists like Prince and Quincy Jones.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with R&B musician Leon Thomas, who describes his new EP Pholks as a collaboration of polymaths inspired by multi-talented artists like Prince and Quincy Jones.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: A youth orchestra in Ukraine creates an overture with the sounds of war
item.description: A youth orchestra in the Kyiv region composes a symphonic poem, re-creating the sound of wartime nights in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: A youth orchestra in the Kyiv region composes a symphonic poem, re-creating the sound of wartime nights in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: What today's inflation report says about the economy -- and Social Security checks
item.description: Because of the shutdown, the federal government is belatedly releasing new Consumer Price Index numbers, which the Social Security Administration needs to adjust for next year's benefits.
item.content:encoded: Because of the shutdown, the federal government is belatedly releasing new Consumer Price Index numbers, which the Social Security Administration needs to adjust for next year's benefits.
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: Alaskan village destroyed by flooding tries to rebuild as winter looms
item.description: Over a week after ex-typhoon Halong swept through western Alaska, people in the affected villages are taking stock. In Kipnuk, state officials estimate that over 90% of structures have been destroyed.
item.content:encoded: Over a week after ex-typhoon Halong swept through western Alaska, people in the affected villages are taking stock. In Kipnuk, state officials estimate that over 90% of structures have been destroyed.
item.dc:creator: Eric Stone

item.title: Billboard Latin Music Awards crown Bad Bunny as the century's top artist
item.description: Last night's Billboard Latin Music awards honored Bad Bunny, who received the lifetime achievement award. When the legendary Rita Moreno handed it off, the moment was like the passing of a baton.
item.content:encoded: Last night's Billboard Latin Music awards honored Bad Bunny, who received the lifetime achievement award. When the legendary Rita Moreno handed it off, the moment was like the passing of a baton.
item.dc:creator: Kai McNamee

item.title: FBI says card shuffling machines were hacked as part of major illegal gambling schemes
item.description: The FBI says card shuffling machines were hacked to cheat at poker as part of a major illegal gambling scheme. NPR's Ailsa Chang talks to a reporter who's been covering the machines' vulnerabilities.
item.content:encoded: The FBI says card shuffling machines were hacked to cheat at poker as part of a major illegal gambling scheme. NPR's Ailsa Chang talks to a reporter who's been covering the machines' vulnerabilities.
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Marquez Janse

item.title: A former top U.S. diplomat to Venezuela weighs in on President Trump's actions there
item.description: NPR's Adrian Florido talks with ambassador James B. Story, a former top diplomat to Venezuela, about the rising tensions between the U.S. and Venezuela, and what President Trump's goals might be.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Adrian Florido talks with ambassador James B. Story, a former top diplomat to Venezuela, about the rising tensions between the U.S. and Venezuela, and what President Trump's goals might be.
item.dc:creator: Erika Ryan

item.title: The World Series starts tonight, with Ohtani and Guerrero Jr. set to shine
item.description: The World Series gets underway Friday evening in Toronto between the Blue Jays and Los Angeles Dodgers. The Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani and Blue Jays' Vladimir Guerrero Jr. are set to shine.
item.content:encoded: The World Series gets underway Friday evening in Toronto between the Blue Jays and Los Angeles Dodgers. The Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani and Blue Jays' Vladimir Guerrero Jr. are set to shine.
item.dc:creator: Steve Futterman

item.title: Western Union says its core business of money transfers in the U.S. is down
item.description: A core business line for Western Union is migrant workers in the U.S. sending money back home. An earnings call reflects a lot less of that since President Trump took office.
item.content:encoded: A core business line for Western Union is migrant workers in the U.S. sending money back home. An earnings call reflects a lot less of that since President Trump took office.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Mulholland

item.title: Why a little-known utility board election is a big deal in Georgia
item.description: Republicans in Georgia are worried about losing a rare off-year election in November because rural voters might not show up at the polls.
item.content:encoded: Republicans in Georgia are worried about losing a rare off-year election in November because rural voters might not show up at the polls.
item.dc:creator: Emily Jones
